lowerCourt: United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit

wikiData.title: Bell v. Cone
wikiData.FullName: Ricky Bell, Warden v. Gary Bradford Cone
wikiData.Prior: ''Cone v. Bell'', 956 [[F. Supp.]] [https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/956/1401/1895043/ 1401] ([[W.D. Tenn.]] 1997); affirmed in part, reversed in part, 243 [[F.3d]] [https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F3/243/961/603746/ 961] ([[United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit|6th Cir.]] 2001); cert. granted, {{ussc|534|1064|2001|el=no}}.
wikiData.Subsequent: ''Cone v. Bell'', 359 [[F.3d]] [https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F3/359/785/577566/ 785] (6th Cir. 2004), reversed and remanded by {{ussc|name=Bell v. Cone|link=|volume=543|page=447|pin=|year=2005}} (''per curiam''); ''Cone v. Bell'', 492 [[F.3d]] [https://www.leagle.com/decision/20071235492f3d74311230 743] (6th Cir. 2007), vacated by {{ussc|name=Cone v. Bell|volume=556|page=449|pin=463|year=2009}}.
wikiData.Holding: Tennessee state courts did not unreasonably apply clearly established law when determining whether the defendant in this case was denied effective assistance of counsel
wikiData.JoinMajority: O'Connor, Scalia, Kennedy, Souter, Thomas, Ginsburg, Breyer
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996]], {{USCSub|28|2254|d}}
